metadata.message: If you use this software, please cite it as below.
metadata.title: Dataset of code metrics
Demo of Harvester-Curator
metadata.abstract:
Harvester-Curator is a tool designed to elevate metadata provision in data and/or software repositories. In the first phase, it acts as a scanner, navigating through user code and/or data repositories to identify suitable parsers for different file types. It collects metadata from each of the files by applying corresponding parsers and then compiles this information into a structured JSON file, providing researchers with a seamless and automated solution for metadata collection. 

Moving to the second phase, Harvester-Curator transforms into a curator, leveraging the harvested metadata to populate metadata fields in a target repository. By automating this process, it not only relieves researchers of the manual burden but also ensures the accuracy and comprehensiveness of the metadata. Beyond its role in streamlining the intricate task of metadata collection, this tool contributes to the broader objective of elevating data accessibility and interoperability within repositories.

group_metadata.Sensor Type: Thermometrics Climate RTD 100  Omega  Probe and Met One 076B aspirated radiation shield

dataset_attributes.date: Date and time of the first measurement
dataset_attributes.max: The maximum temperature of numPts in Celcius, over a given time range
dataset_attributes.mean: The mean temperature of numPts in Celcius, calculated over a given time range
dataset_attributes.min: The minimum temperature of numPts in Celcius, over a given time range
dataset_attributes.numPts: The number of points used to calculate each summary measure
dataset_attributes.stdErr: The standard error of the mean temperature of numPts in Celcius, calculated over a given time range
dataset_attributes.uncertainty: The uncertainty of the mean temperature, over a given time range, calculated from NEON.DOC.XXX
dataset_attributes.variance: The variance temperature of numPts in Celcius, calculated over a given time range
